You're using an older browser that is not supported by Fork CMS. Use one of the following alternatives:

  • Firefox: a very good browser with a lot of free extensions.
  • Safari: one of the fastest and most advanced browsers. Good for Mac users.
  • Chrome: Google's browser - also very fast.
  • Internet Explorer*: update to the latest version of Internet Explorer.

pages.FallbackInfo:
Not every block could automatically be assigned to a position.

Blocks that were added to positions that are not available in this template, are shown here. Default blocks from the previous template that are not present in the current template are also displayed here.
You can easily drag them to the desired position.

These blocks will disappear after saving the page or selecting another template.

extensions.ConfirmDeleteTemplate: Are your sure you want to delete the template "%1$s"?
extensions.ConfirmModuleInstall: Are you sure you want to install the module "%1$s"?
extensions.ConfirmThemeInstall: Are you sure you want to install this theme?
extensions.CronjobsInfo:
Cronjobs periodically, on a set timeframe, perform a call to script.
Cronjobs can be executed either through commandline as well as over your webserver.
When setting cronjobs on servers with several Fork CMS installations try to spread the execution by changing the minutes parameter.

Commandline: php %1$s/backend/cronjob.php module=module action=action
Webserver: /usr/bin/wget -O - --quiet --timeout=1440 "%2$s/backend/cronjob.php?module=module&action=action"
extensions.HelpInstallableThemes: Click a theme to install it.
extensions.HelpOverwrite: Attention! Checking this checkbox will cause the content of every page to be reset to the defaults chosen here-above.
extensions.HelpPositionsLayout:
A visual representation to be used in the pages-module.
  • Add a row: use []
  • Reflect a position: use position name
  • Reflect a non-editable area: use /

If you want a position to display wider or higher in it's graphical representation, repeat the position multiple times (both horizontal and vertical, but the shape should form a rectangle)

A template could look like the chart below:
[  /   ,  /   ,  /   ,  /   ,  top ],
[  /   ,  /   ,  /   ,  /   ,  /   ],
[ left , main , main , main , right],
[bottom,bottom,bottom,bottom,bottom]
extensions.HelpTemplateLocation: Put your templates in the core/layout/templates folder of your theme.
extensions.HelpThemes: Select the theme you wish to use.
extensions.InformationFileCouldNotBeLoaded: A info.xml file is present but it could not be loaded. Verify if the content is valid XML.
extensions.InformationFileIsEmpty: A info.xml file is present but its either empty or it does not contain valuable information.
extensions.InformationModuleIsNotInstalled: This module is not yet installed.
extensions.InformationThemeIsNotInstalled: This theme is not yet installed.
extensions.ModulesNotWritable: We do not have write rights to the modules folders. Check if you have write rights on the modules folders in all applications.
extensions.ModulesWarnings: There are some warnings for following module(s)
extensions.ThemesNotWritable: We do not have write rights to the themes folder. Check if you have write rights on the themes folders in the frontend-application.
extensions.ZipArchiveIsMissing:
Your server is missing the required PHP "ZipArchive" class. Fork CMS needs this class to be able to unpack your uploaded module.

  • Contact your server administrator with the above message.
  • Or unpack the ZIP archive on your computer and upload the folders manually (most likely via FTP) to your website root.
extensions.ZlibIsMissing:
Your server is missing the required PHP "Zlib" extension. Fork CMS needs this extension to be able to unpack your uploaded module.

  • Contact your server administrator with the above message.
  • Or unpack the ZIP archive on your computer and upload the folders manually (most likely via FTP) to your website root.
